articles.author: Derrick Bryson Taylor
articles.title: Anheuser-Busch to give away free beer when America hits its vaccination goal. - The New York Times
articles.description: The company said it would “buy America’s next round” once 70 percent of U.S. adults had received at least one dose of a vaccine.
articles.content:
The brewing giant Anheuser-Busch said on Wednesday that it would offer Americans another incentive to get vaccinated: free beer.
The company said in a statement that it would buy Americas next round… [+1100 chars]

articles.title: Sailing: Hosting next America's Cup in Auckland 'doesn't make sense', says leading economist - Newshub
articles.description: "When governments compete with each other to subsidise boat races that rich people tend to enjoy, the winners aren't taxpayers."
articles.content:
Before the last Cup, the Council and Government spent $289m on clearing the tank farm, building the bases, and hosting the event.
Leading economist Eric Crampton says the juice isn't worth the squee… [+634 chars]

articles.author: Samuel Chamberlain, Steven Nelson
articles.title: 'This was not a riot. This was a massacre,' says Biden on 100th anniversary of Tulsa slaughter of black Americans - New York Post
articles.description: On the 100th anniversary of the Tulsa Massacre, President Joe Biden became the first commander-in-chief to commemorate the incident when he spoke from Oklahoma on Tuesday.
articles.content: President Biden on Tuesday became the first chief executive to commemorate the 1921 Tulsa race massacre that claimed the lives of dozens if not hundreds of black Americans 100 years, declaring, “This… [+4999 chars]

articles.title: Biden honours victims of Tulsa race massacre on 100th anniversary of killings - CBC.ca
articles.description: Joe Biden on Tuesday became the first sitting U.S. president to visit the site of the massacre of hundreds of Black Americans by a white mob in Tulsa, Okla., as he marks one of the worst chapters in the country's history of racial violence.
articles.content: Joe Biden on Tuesday became the first sitting U.S. president to visit the site of the massacre of hundreds of Black Americans by a white mob in Tulsa, Okla., as he marks one of the worst chapters in … [+4434 chars]
